P057296.project_name: Emergency Multisector Rehabilitation and Reconstruction Project

keywords.cdata: ADB,Agriculture,airports,capacity building,Community Development,development strategies,development strategy,Electricity,expenditures,Financial Management,FISCAL YEAR,Health services,institutional reform,m1,Operating costs,Private Sector,Procurement,project implementation,Roads,self financing,Service contracts,social services,Technical assistance,Transport,Urban infrastructure,Urban Services,Water Supply

project_abstract.cdata: The purpose of the Emergency Multisector Rehabilitation and Reconstruction Project, is to initiate the long-term process of reconstruction, and economic rehabilitation. The project comprises four components: 1) rehabilitation, and reconstruction of critical infrastructure - transport, water supply, electricity, and urban infrastructure; 2) agricultural development, delivery of social services - education, health care, and social protection - and, community development; 3) development of sector strategies for the medium, and long term, and, strengthening of human, and institutional capacities; and, 4) management, monitoring and evaluation of project implementation. The project will help prevent the further deterioration of health, and loss of peoples lives, by increasing food security, delivering health care, and other basic services, restoring water, and energy supply services, and will lay the foundation for future policy, and institutional reforms. These benefits will far outweigh the risks of failure within the peace process, or the potential for conflict resumption.

P057296.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectAbstract>L’efficience et l’efficacité du secteur public d’un pays jouent un rôle vital dans le succès des activités de développement, notamment de celles que soutient la Banque mondiale. Une saine gestion financière, une fonction publique et une politique administrative efficientes et efficaces et un recouvrement équitable de l’impôt ainsi que des opérations transparentes relativement exemptes de corruption sont autant de facteurs qui contribuent à une prestation satisfaisante des services publics.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
